description: This file provides utility functions for managing a MongoDB client within a Flask application's context. It includes functions to obtain a MongoClient instance, retrieve a database handle, and clean up the client during application teardown.

methods.name: MongoClient get_mongo_client()
methods.description: Provides a singleton MongoClient instance stored in Flask's application context. Creates the client if it doesn't exist by loading configuration settings.

methods.name: get_db()
methods.description: Retrieves the database handle using the current MongoDB client and configuration.

methods.name: teardown_mongo_client(exception=None)
methods.description: Closes and removes the MongoClient from Flask's application context during teardown.
